intro: Daphnandra novoguineenis, commonly known as the New Guinea daphnandra, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. The plant features opposite, simple, and elliptic leaves with a glossy upper surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have four petals. The fruit is a small capsule that contains several seeds.
